item.title: Public classes send color to the batch file?
item.dc:creator: @Itachi_Uchiha Itachi Uchiha
item.description:
@Itachi_Uchiha wrote:

I am trying to get my public outputs to read in color when displayed on the command prompt to highlight certain data:

public Frames() { String server = "B3rnscape"; String openBR = "["; String closeBR = "]"; String dataInputio = "LOADED.Engine_io_classfileData"; System.out.println(server + openBR + Misc.getDate() + closeBR + openBR + dataInputio + closeBR + " >>> Frames Class."); }

How would I go about apply color to the individual strings through the command prompt, or can I not do this? If I cannot is there a program similar to batch that will? O.o

Here is what I have so far towards a separate class:

[code]package B3rnscape.Java.data;

import javax.swing.text.;
import javax.swing.;
//import java.awt.*;
import java.awt.Color;

public class JTextImpliment extends JTextArea {

public static void append(String s, Color c) {
	append(s, c.green); //Not sure if this will do much good, ripped from a textArea program.
}

}[/code]
Not really much…but oh well…That is why I am asking for help x.x…

Read full topic
item.source: Public classes send color to the batch file?
